title: Peru: 81% of foreign tourists wish to return to CuscoTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Peru: 81% of foreign tourists wish to return to Cusco  
The recently-created Cusco Tourism Observatory reported that about 92% of foreign tourists, who participated in Cusco festivities over the current year, would recommend them to relatives and friends; whereas 81% expressed their wish to return to Peru’s main tourism destination.
The objective of the observatory is to enhance tourism competitiveness in the region. The information collected answers from 571 foreign tourists.
Out of the surveyed tourists, 52% of visitors to the Imperial City regarded as good the organization of activities held last June and 88% expressed to have felt safe in the Archeological Capital of the Americas.
The information will be posted on social networks, websites and blogs, Observatory Manager Fernando Santoyo Vargas pointed out.
About 91% of surveyed national tourists, who visited the Imperial City in June 2015, suggested learning about the Inti Raymi (Festival of the Sun), whereas 83% affirmed they would go back and 58% described the organization of this and other cultural festivities “as good.”
